Install libraries if not already installed
```{r setup, echo = FALSE, include=FALSE}
libraries = c("knitr","tidyverse", "nycflights13", "ggplot2", "palmerpenguins", "ggthemes")

for(i in 1:length(libraries)) { 
	if (!requireNamespace(libraries[i], quietly = TRUE)) {
		install.packages(libraries[i]) 
	}
	# Load library
	library(libraries[i], character.only = TRUE)
}

opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

# 1. 

Display the data
```{r, echo = FALSE}
dplyr::glimpse(flights)
```

# 2. 

Get the data |> Select Jan flights |> Group by carrier |> Calculate the mean and sd of the distance per carrier |> List in asc order of the mean distance
```{r, echo = FALSE}
tbl <- flights |> filter(month == 1) |> group_by(carrier) |> summarise(mean_distance = mean(distance), sd_distance = sd(distance)) |> arrange(mean_distance)
dplyr::glimpse(tbl)
```

# 3.

NOTE: The following is based on using a sample standard deviation\
Based on eye balling the output we can immediately see that carrier OO has NA for the distance sd\
.. carrier YV has 0 ..

Carriers with 1 or zero data points for month 1 have NA as the distance sd since it does not exists
```{r, echo = FALSE}
tbl_2 <- flights |> filter(carrier == "OO", month == 1)
dplyr::glimpse(tbl_2)
```

Carriers with identical values of the distances have 0 as the observations equal to the mean
```{r, echo = FALSE}
tbl_2 <- flights |> filter(carrier == "YV", month == 1)
dplyr::glimpse(tbl_2)
```

# 4. 
```{r, echo = FALSE}
carriers_df <- flights |> group_by(month, carrier) |> summarize(mean_dep = mean(dep_delay, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") |> pivot_wider(names_from = carrier, values_from = mean_dep)
dplyr::glimpse(carriers_df)
```

# 5.
```{r, echo = FALSE}
dplyr::glimpse(nrow(flights |> filter(dep_delay > 0, arr_delay <= 0)) / nrow(flights))
```

Identify routes that more than one airline flies
```{r, echo = FALSE}
dplyr::glimpse(airlines)
dplyr::glimpse(flights)
```

# 6

## 6.1
```{r, echo = FALSE}
routes <- flights |> group_by(origin, dest) |> summarize(N = n_distinct(carrier), .groups = "drop") |> filter(N>1)
dplyr::glimpse(routes)
```

## 6.2
```{r, echo = FALSE}
avg_delay <- flights |> group_by(origin, dest, carrier) |>
	summarise(mean_delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop") |>
	semi_join(routes, by = c("origin", "dest")) |> left_join(airlines, by = "carrier")
dplyr::glimpse(avg_delay)
```

## 6.3
```{r, echo = FALSE}
extremes <- avg_delay |> group_by(origin, dest) |> 
	summarise(
		best_carrier   = carrier[which.min(mean_delay)],
		best_name      = name[which.min(mean_delay)],
		best_delay     = min(mean_delay),
		worst_carrier  = carrier[which.max(mean_delay)],
		worst_name     = name[which.max(mean_delay)],
		worst_delay    = max(mean_delay),
		.groups        = "drop")
dplyr::glimpse(extremes)
```

## 6.4
```{r, echo = FALSE}
extremes <- extremes |> mutate(delay_diff = worst_delay - best_delay)
worst_route <- extremes |> filter(delay_diff == max(delay_diff, na.rm = TRUE))
```

Route with the greatest difference between best and worst performing airlines:
```{r, echo = FALSE}
dplyr::glimpse(worst_route)
```
